remarks: Lemma for ~ psgnuni .  It is impossible to shift a transposition off the end because if the active transposition is at the right end, it is the only transposition moving ` A ` in contradiction to this being a representation of the identity.  (Contributed by Stefan O'Rear, 25-Aug-2015.)  (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 28-Feb-2016.)
statement:
psgnunilem2.g $e |- G = ( SymGrp ` D ) $.
psgnunilem2.t $e |- T = ran ( pmTrsp ` D ) $.
psgnunilem2.d $e |- ( ph -> D e. V ) $.
psgnunilem2.w $e |- ( ph -> W e. Word T ) $.
psgnunilem2.id $e |- ( ph -> ( G gsum W ) = ( _I |` D ) ) $.
psgnunilem2.l $e |- ( ph -> ( # ` W ) = L ) $.
psgnunilem2.ix $e |- ( ph -> I e. ( 0 ..^ L ) ) $.
psgnunilem2.a $e |- ( ph -> A e. dom ( ( W ` I ) \ _I ) ) $.
psgnunilem2.al $e |- ( ph -> A. k e. ( 0 ..^ I ) -. A e. dom ( ( W ` k ) \ _I ) ) $.
psgnunilem5 $p |- ( ph -> ( I + 1 ) e. ( 0 ..^ L ) ) $.
$d A k $.
$d G k $.
$d I k $.
$d W k $.
